questions.metaData: Source: Christopher M. Jones and Daniel M. Kammen,  Quantifying Carbon Footprint Reduction Opportunities for U.S. Households and Communities. Supporting Materials. Environ. Sci. Technol., 2011, 45 (9), pp 4088–4095.
questions.text: How much do you spend on furniture and appliances each year?

questions.metaData:
Source: Christopher M. Jones and Daniel M. Kammen,  Quantifying Carbon

questions.text: How much do you spend on paper products (newspapers, books, textbooks, magazines etc.) each month?
How much do you spend on personal care and cleaning supplies each month?

questions.text: How much do you spend on computers, tablets, phones, and other electronics in a year?

questions.metaData: Source: http://www.carbonfootprint.com/calculatorfaqs.html Dollars * 0.3kg/english pound * conversion rate (updated 5.5.17) * 12 months.
questions.text: How much do you spend on new clothing in a given month?
How much do you spend on entertainment and other recreational activities per month?
If you drink your water from nonrefillable plastic bottles, how many do you buy per week?
